title.narrative: Zambia - National Rural Water Supply and Sanitation Program

description.narrative: National Rural Water Supply and Sanitation Program (NRWSSP) is elaborated in 2005 by the Government of the Republic of Zambia (GRZ) with support from a number of Cooperating Partners (CPs) to guide government and donor interventions in the rural areas. The overall sector goal of the NRWSSP is to improve the quality of life and productivity of all Zambians by ensuring an equitable provision of adequate quantity and quality of water to all competing user groups, and improved sanitation services for all, at acceptable cost and on a sustainable basis. The program is to be implemented in two phases – I (2006-2010) and II (2011-2015). its overall cost is estimated at US$ 292 million. The program has four components, namely: a) Water infrastructure development; b) Sanitation and Hygiene Education; c) Institutional Support and Capacity Building; and d)Program Management.

The direct beneficiaries of the proposed program are the rural people who do not have access to clean water and safe sanitation. Other beneficiaries will include the central and local government institutions whose capacity will be enhanced, the artisans who will be trained and assisted to establish repair outlets for water supply and sanitation systems, the private sector who will participate in the implementation of the program.

The overall objective in the period 2006-2015 is to provide sustainable access to water supply and sanitation in rural areas so as to facilitate the achievement of the MDG for water and sanitation and to contribute towards poverty alleviation of Zambia’s rural population. The specific objectives of the first phase of the National Rural Water Supply and Sanitation Program is to increase access to safe, reliable and convenient quantities of water supply from present 37% to 55% of the rural population by 2010; and to increase access to proper sanitation from 13% to 33% of the rural population by 2010.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Local Government and Housing, Deptartment of Infrastructure and Support Services (DISS)

mailing-address.narrative: African Development Bank Group Headquarters Avenue Joseph Anoma 01 BP 1387 Abidjan 01, Côte d'Ivoire
